events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving rear-end collision yesterday evening on the highway.
The claim was categorized under auto accident after reviewing the initial report and customer statement.
An agent has been assigned to handle the auto accident claim and contact the insured for further details.
The insurer acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured customer of support throughout the process.
Requested the accident report, photos of vehicle damage, and police report to proceed with claim investigation.
Customer submitted all required documents including police report and photographs of the damaged car.
Investigation team began examining the claim details, assessing the collision circumstances and damage extent.
Investigation completed confirming liability and damage assessment aligning with submitted accident evidence.
A settlement amount was proposed based on repair estimates and policy coverage after investigation results.
Customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the timely and fair proposed settlement offer.
The claim was officially approved according to terms and conditions of the auto insurance policy.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued to the customerâ€™s designated bank account.
After payment, the claim case was closed successfully with no further outstanding issues reported.
The auto accident claim documents and records were archived for future reference and compliance.
